result.execSummary:
The defendant Chandler J. Spencer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain full time employment/30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for.

DNA sample if not given.
No contact with any victims or their residences.
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: 9:21 AM/Rm. 203/Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Chandler J. Spencer in court, in custody.  Attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer in court for Chandler J. Spencer.  Court Reporter by Zoom.  Court calls 22CF70, 21CF342, 21CT24, 21TR494, 21CF293, 22CF92, 21TR495, 21TR493, 21CM139.  Agreement:  22CF92/plea to Ct. 1, time served.  Def. to remain in custody until today.  D&RI remaining counts.  22CF70/plea to Ct 1, D&RI Cts, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, plea to Ct 5, plea to Ct 7.  22CF342/Cts. 1, 2 and 3 D&RI,  plea to Cts. 4 and 5, dismiss & consolidate Ct. 6 that will be in information.  21CM139/plea to Ct 2, D&RI Ct. 1.  21CF293/plea to Ct. 1, D&RI Cts. 2 and 3.  21CT24/D&RI.  Recommendation joint:  22CF70/Ct. 1 - sentence withheld, 4 years probation, costs, DNA sample if not already done and surcharge, no contact with victims or their residences, AODA & follow through with treatment, absolute sobriety, restitution $356.95, maintain employment, counseling as deemed necessary by agent.  Ct. 5 - impose & stay 6 months jail, consecutive to any other sentence, 3 years probation, costs, DNA, same conditions as Ct. 1, Ct. 7 - sentence withheld, 3 years probation, costs, same conditions as Ct. 1.  21CF342/Ct. 4 - 90 days jail consecutive to any other sentence, $2,500.00 total fine and costs, revoked 28 months, IID 28 months, alcohol assessment and driver safety plan.  Ct. 5 - 5 days jail consecutive to any other sentence, costs, DNA.  21CM139/1 year jail consecutive to any other sentence, imposed & stayed, 2 years probation, costs, DNA, same conditions.  21CF293/sentence withheld, 4 years probation, costs, DNA, same conditions.  Victim rights complied with.  All traffic citations to be dismissed.  Court advises Def. of right to preliminary hearing in 22CF70, 21CF293, 22CF92.  Def. waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver, finds probable cause and binds cases over.  Def.'s Atty. waives reading of informations which DA is in the process of filing and emailing copies to Def.'s Atty.  All informations mirror complaint with the exception of PAC count being added.  Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights form filed.  Court reviews with Def.  22CF70/Ct. 1 - guilty plea.  Ct. 5 - guilty plea.  Ct. 7 - guilty plea.  21CF342/Ct. 4 - OWI 3 - guilty plea.  Ct. 5 - guilty plea.  21CF293/Ct. 1 - guilty plea.  22CF92/Ct. 1 - guilty plea.  21CM139/Ct. 2 - guilty plea.  Court grants motion to D&RI:  22CF70/Cts. 2, 3, 4, 6, 8.  21CF342/Cts. 1, 2 and 3,  Ct. 6 dismissed & consolidated.  21CT24/Cts. 1 and 2.  21TR494 dismissed, 21CF293/Cts. 2 and 3.  22CF92/Cts. 2, 3, 4 and 5.  21TR495 dismissed, 21TR493/dismissed.  21cm139/Ct. 1.  Court advises Def. of constitutional rights and right to jury trial.  Def. waives rights and jury trial.  Court advises Def. of elements and penalties.  Def. advised of possible deportation if not US citizen.  Court finds pleas entered freely and voluntarily.  Factual basis.  Court accepts pleas and finds Def. guilty of:  22CF70/Ct. 1, Ct. 5, Ct. 7.  21CF242/Ct. 4, Ct. 5.  21CF293/Ct. 1.  22CF292/Ct. 1.  21CM139/Ct. 2.  Sentencing remarks by State.  9:58 a.m./break.  10:01 a.m./back on record.  Sentencing remarks by Def.'s Atty.  Def. makes statement to Court.  Court orders:  22CF70/Ct. 1 - sentence withheld, 4 years probation, costs, DNA sample if not already given and surcharge, no contact with any victims or their residences, complete AODA & follow through with recommendations, maintain absolute sobriety, restitution $356.95, employment, counseling as deemed necessary by agent.  Ct. 5 - impose & stay 6 months jail, huber, consecutive to any other sentence, 3 years probation, costs, DNA surcharge, same conditions.  Ct. 7 - sentence withheld, 3 years probation, costs, DNA surcharge, same conditions.  21CF342/Ct. 4 - 90 days jail, consecutive to any other sentence, huber, $2,500.00 total fine and costs, revoked 28 months, IID 28 months, alcohol assessment and driver safety plan.  Ct. 5 - 5 days jail, consecutive to any other sentence, costs, DNA surcharge.  Huber on all jail sentences.  21CF293/Ct. 1 - sentence withheld, 4 years probation, costs, DNA surcharge, same conditions.  22CF92/Ct. 1 - time served - 81 days, costs, DNA surcharge.  21CM139/Ct. 2 - impose & stay 1 year jail, huber, 2 years probation, costs, same conditions.  Bonds - 22CF70/$10,000 bond applied to that case, balance to be returned to poster.  21CF342/$7,500 bond applied to that case, balance returned to poster.  21CT24/$250.00 to be returned to poster.  21CF293/no bond.  22CF92/no bond - costs to be paid today or payment plan.  21CM139/$1,000 applied to that case, balance return to poster.  Credit - 22CF92/84 days credit. (verified with Court sentence is 84 days instead of 81)  22CF70/11 days credit if revoked.  21CF342/4 days credit.  No credit in any of the other cases.  21CT24/0 days.  21CF293/0 days.  21CM139/0 days if revoked.  Def. advised of voting and firearm rights.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Def. advised of postconviction rights.  BAC .178
for bond reduction -Routed to CCJA

Bail/Bond
Maintain absolute sobriety, no presence in establishments with class B liquor license, no contact with victim one and two and their residence or location.

01:55 PM Defendant Chandler J. Spencer in court, in custody. Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Chandler J. Spencer appeared by video means. All parties via Zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties. Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Defendant has chosen a public defender. DA gives argument and recommendation of a cash bond of $10,000.00 with conditions of maintain absolute sobriety, no presence in establishments with class B liquor license, no contact with victim one and two and their residence or location. Defendant gives bond argument and requests a lower cash bond. Court gives ruling. Court orders a $10,000 cash bond with conditions of maintain absolute sobriety, no presence in establishments with class B liquor license, no contact with victim one and two and their residence or location. Court is adjourned. Adjourned Initial Appearance is scheduled 4/18/22 at 1:30pm.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
